newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-IKPEBA SCORES TWICE AS CHAMPIONS MONACO WIN 3-0 AWAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-IKPEBA SCORES TWICE AS CHAMPIONS MONACO WIN 3-0 AWAY.

text.p: Croatian striker Robert Spehar found the net 14 minutes into his Monaco debut and Nigeria's Victor Ikpeba scored twice as the champions beat Lyon 3-0 away in the French first division on Saturday.
Monaco, who signed Spehar 48 hours ago, won for the first time this season after a defeat and a draw and are five points behind Paris St Germain and Metz.
PSG went top on goal difference as two former Lyon players, Franck Gava and Florian Maurice, inspired them to a 3-1 home win over Cannes.
Maurice laid on the first goal for Italian striker Marco Simone and Gava scored the crucial second after Cannes equalised with Dane Brian Jensen's second penalty in three matches.
PSG's Brazilian captain Rai scored the third goal in the 89th minute that lifted them over Metz, 2-1 winners at Chateauroux on Friday.
